snippet: In surviving a recall effort, Gov. Scott Walker succeeded in breaking the political power of public unions and changed politics in a once-reliable blue state.
abstract: Editorial contends that by surviving a recall effort in Wisconsin, Gov Scott Walker has succeeded in breaking the political power of public unions, changing the political landscape in a once-reliable blue state; argues that Walker's victory does not guarantee that Mitt Romney will seize the state in the November elections.
lead_paragraph: In surviving a recall effort, Gov. Scott Walker succeeded in breaking the political power of public unions and changed politics in a once-reliable blue state.
